column3: Back

Well, I’m not really sure what to say.
Well, maybe we can try again tomorrow.
Well, that’s one way of looking at it.
Well, it depends on the weather.
Well, let’s see what happens.

It’s, you know, kind of hard to explain.
She’s, you know, always late.
The film was, you know, really good.
He’s, you know, not very reliable.
It’s, you know, a long story.

It’s not bad, I mean, it could be worse.
I was tired, I mean, really exhausted.
He’s nice, I mean, most of the time.
It’s far, I mean, about two hours.
I don’t hate it, I mean, it’s okay.

Let me think… yes, I can come Friday.
Let me think… no, I’ve never been there.
Let me think… about eight o’clock?
Let me think… maybe next week.
Let me think… actually, I’m not sure.

Um… I think it was last year?
Um… can you repeat the question?
Um… I’m not really sure.
Um… maybe around seven?
Um… let me check my phone.

Uh… could you say that again?
Uh… I don’t remember the name.
Uh… I think it’s on the left?
Uh… give me a second.
Uh… that’s a good question.

Hmm… that’s an interesting idea.
Hmm… I’m not completely convinced.
Hmm… let me see the menu again.
Hmm… maybe we should wait.
Hmm… yes, I think you’re right.

Let’s see… I have three options.
Let’s see… tomorrow at six?
Let’s see… that was 2019, I think.
Let’s see… maybe the blue one?
Let’s see… yes, I can make it.

How can I put it… it’s not exactly cheating.
How can I put it… I just don’t like him.
How can I put it… it’s complicated.
How can I put it… you’re too nice.
How can I put it… it’s kind of weird.

It’s hard to say if it’ll rain tomorrow.
It’s hard to say who’s going to win.
It’s hard to say how long it will take.
It’s hard to say why she left.
It’s hard to say what he’s thinking.

I’m not sure if I turned off the oven.
I’m not sure what time the film starts.
I’m not sure whether to go or stay.
I’m not sure that’s a good idea.
I’m not sure I remember correctly.

It depends on the traffic.
It depends how tired I am.
It depends what time you finish.
It depends on the price.
It depends who’s coming.

Do you like it? — Kind of.
It’s kind of cold in here.
I kind of forgot, sorry.
She’s kind of shy at first.
It works, kind of.

I sort of understand what you mean.
It’s sort of working now.
He sort of smiled, but not really.
The weather’s sort of okay.
I sort of remember her name.

Have you finished? — More or less.
It’s more or less the same price.
I more or less agree with you.
We’re more or less ready.
The translation is more or less correct.

To some extent, you’re right.
To some extent, it’s my fault.
To some extent, money does buy happiness.
To some extent, luck plays a part.
To some extent, we all make mistakes.

In a sense, we’re all beginners.
In a sense, failing is good.
In a sense, he never grew up.
In a sense, it’s already too late.
In a sense, silence is an answer.

He became, as it were, our leader.
It’s a prison, as it were, of our own making.
She’s the boss, as it were.
We’re trapped, as it were, by routine.
He’s a king, as it were, in his own house.

We’re all in the same boat, so to speak.
He’s the big cheese, so to speak.
It’s a jungle out there, so to speak.
She’s rolling in it, so to speak.
I’m dead tired, so to speak.

It’s, like, the best feeling ever.
I was, like, totally shocked.
He’s, like, really tall.
She was, like, “No way!”
It costs, like, a thousand pounds.
